channel.title: Ideas for a CSS map
channel.description: I am going to map, and I need ideas. It should not too generic. Also should have bit of indoors and outdoors. All ideas will be appreciated.

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
calhoun freeman:

Necro. But ah well.

QL is short for Quake Live, a free to play browser based FPS, developed by id software, and is about 99% similar to Quake 3, but with no mods except HUDs, and with no gore. It’s currently replaced Q3 as a Quakecon official game.

That’s what I was figuring, but I wasn’t sure. My best guess would have been Quake Lite.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
calhoun freeman:

Well, play QL first, then start playing CSS. You won’t burn out that fast.

Most likely because you will burn out permanently from playing QL.

Please forgive my ignorance, but what exactly is QL?

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Welcome to my castle.:

Also make the maps feel alive, and moving, add a moving car, some water dripping, birds in the sky etc.
Use high resolution textures with quality normal maps 1024 x 1204 or higher

This kind of thing was in CSS maps. Not sure about water dripping, but there was steam.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Sittin_on_tha_toilet
item.description:
Make a Quake 3 based map

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Welcome_to_my_castle
item.description:
Let me give you some tips

Some of the ways I come up with idea’s is browsing images on google earth
Not only do I learn things from it too, but I familiarize myself with new places

Remember the CSS community is slowly dying away, if you think about it the community was much bigger 1-2 years ago

People want new themes, and balanced maps
I can’t even stand CS_OFFICE, that map is boring
Also make the maps feel alive, and moving, add a moving car, some water dripping, birds in the sky etc.
Use high resolution textures with quality normal maps 1024 x 1204 or higher

Make your own new content, models, textures etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map

Well, play QL first, then start playing CSS. You won’t burn out that fast.

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Now, I wouldn’t say that. I usually go on for the custom maps. Try to play anyone on either of those two maps, and I’d die in two seconds. It’d be worse than Call of Duty.

In fact, the custom content, including skins and maps, is the only reason why I still play CS:Source. Without it, I would’ve burned out a long time ago.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Deimos
item.description:
The only people who still play CSS play De_Dust2 and Office, make a map for another game

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
I’d say make a Minecraft map, but it looks like a zm_minecraft has been done already. Though it would be a great start to learn the basics of texture mapping and layout.

In fact, you could build it in Minecraft first, and then take that into Hammer by emulating what you designed in-game.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Nerdguy
item.description:
Make mp_nuketown from Blops

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Spooboy:

I once made a map (long lost) which took place in a run down mansion being used as a terrorist hideout. Set in Spain I believe. The map was a night time/raining map, water and filth were the two biggest elements. As the counter-terrorists you had to breach the house, (if I recall correctly I had a main entrance, which was a ballsy approach, a winery entrance, and a sewer entrance that sort of cut into the winery) and once inside the house it was an all out brawl. I might be interested in re-making this… I had a lot of fun doing it.

Sounds like cs_estate that proliferated quite a bit in the original CS, and then it made its way to Source. I have a couple versions in CS:Source alone.

1024×828 173 KB

It’s exactly as you’ve described. Either way, someone beat you to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Combine
item.description:
Alcrataz island, outlining the plot in The Rock? (lovely movie btw)

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: shifty
item.description:
How about a cave in Afganistan with hostages? Or the slums in Brazil? Or a temple in the jungle? Airport or inside an Airplane? The white house? A bank? (anything thats terrorists think is a good target).

Just re-watch any action movie or tv series and just make it from there. I think the tv show ‘24’ would also have some goodies for you.

I remember some maps would have traps, that was fun

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Spooboy
item.description:
Power_Dust:

I’m regularly looking on GameBanana.com for interesting maps (I don’t download them, just look at the screenshots) and I haven’t seen much suburban maps yet, if you’re going to put real effort into your map it might turn out well. I hate when people make maps that aren’t even half finished or have a very low amount of detail, I like realistic maps with good lighting and much detail.

I once made a map (long lost) which took place in a run down mansion being used as a terrorist hideout. Set in Spain I believe. The map was a night time/raining map, water and filth were the two biggest elements. As the counter-terrorists you had to breach the house, (if I recall correctly I had a main entrance, which was a ballsy approach, a winery entrance, and a sewer entrance that sort of cut into the winery) and once inside the house it was an all out brawl. I might be interested in re-making this… I had a lot of fun doing it.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
I have no idea what sorts of settings CSS maps have already, because I’ve never really played one. I know there was a map that I downloaded for use in a gmod comic (when I was in to that) that was set in a church. Churches or temples are pretty interesting settings. Is there a map that takes place in some suburban cul-de-sac? That might be interesting too.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for a CSS map
item.dc:creator: Jack_Freeman
item.description:
Spooboy:

How about an abandoned cold war missile base. It takes place underground, and maybe the bomb room is a missile silo with the surface doors half open, exposing sunlight. You would have to research what exactly goes into a complex like this, but I think it could turn out pretty cool.

Sounds awesome. Definetly a map i would try.

Read full topic
